title: How to Create a Google Play Music Playlist on Android

steps.title: Open Google Play Music on your Android.
steps.content: Open Google Play Music on your Android. It’s the icon with headphones labeled “Play Music” typically found in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It’s at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap SONGS.
steps.content: Tap SONGS . It’s one of the options near the top of the screen. A list of songs in your library will appear. If you don’t have any songs in your library, tap the magnifying glass icon at the top-right corner of the screen to search for a song.

steps.title: Tap ⁝ on a song you want to add.
steps.content: Tap ⁝ on a song you want to add.

steps.title: Tap Add to playlist.
steps.content: Tap Add to playlist . A list of playlists (if any exist) will appear.

steps.title: Enter a name for the playlist.
steps.content: Enter a name for the playlist. This name is how the playlist will appear in Google Music.

steps.title: Type a description.
steps.content: Type a description. This can help you identify the playlist of you create others.

steps.title: Tap CREATE PLAYLIST.
steps.content: Tap CREATE PLAYLIST . The playlist is now live. It contains one song.

steps.title: Find another song to add.
steps.content: Find another song to add. You can return to the SONGS section or enter some search terms.

steps.title: Tap Add to playlist.
steps.content: Tap Add to playlist . A list of playlists will appear.

steps.title: Tap the playlist you just created.
steps.content: Tap the playlist you just created. The song is added to the playlist. You can continue adding songs to the playlist using this method.
